ygData.subject: weapon choices at 17th level (was: taking the ghoulbane plunge)
ygData.msgSnippet: This has been an interesting and informative thread, I m glad I started it! Consensus seems to be that: A) Wait until you get past level 25 before even trying
ygData.messageBody:
This has been an interesting and informative thread, I'm glad I started it!
Consensus seems to be that:
A) Wait until you get past level 25 before even trying to get the sword,
B) Ghoulbane is extremely hard to get even at lvl 30 and above,
C) There are more appropriate weapons that I should be using until I hit
over level 25.

Seems like for us honest 17th thru 25th level Paladins our weapon choices
are pretty clear:
1. combine longsword or scimitar / shiny brass shield
2. shiny brass halberd
3. hammer of wrath / shiny brass shield
...with the nod going to the shiny brass halberd at level 20.

I *like* the way bash interrupts spells, and would regret not being able to
use it for 5 or more levels. If I switch to a shiny brass halberd then I am
walking away from 1-handed slashing skill which will need to be made up
after I do get ghoulbane.

Are there any other weapon/shield combos I am overlooking that actually
worked for some of you more accomplished Paladins?

Again, thanks everybody for the input.
Kaladin, 17th level Paladin (who is not well known for hiding in safe
corners of Norrath)

Nicholas20@... wrote:

> From: Nicholas20@...
>
> True the druid can "sneak" the paladin down and the paladin can "hide" in the "safe" corner while his friends do the work and then hand him a weapon he did nothing to earn, but any paladin worth a grain of salt who uses these techniques I don't feel they deserve one. First of all there is a sort of honor arranging the group, leading it in, and having an active party
> work together with you contributing. Who needs it at lvl 17 anyways? You won't do max dmg till 20 and the effect won't work as well. There are many other fine weapons out there till then. Second of all in my experience camping this thing, it can go bad very quick..people say you can stay in one room safely and keep a couple spawns controlled, but if you really want to live keep the whole area clean. Trust me it goes much better this way. Some people get lucky and get the sword right away..that has never been my experience as it is still not something I have obtained and i have tried many times. It's a long camp but it will be well worth it if you earn it.
> Shakel Ana'key
> Tarrew Marr
> Paladin of the 35th rank (still has yet to get that blasted sword)
>
>
